Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Telepathy \Te*lep"a*thy\, n. [Gr. ? far off + ?, ?, to suffer.] The sympathetic affection of one mind by the thoughts, feelings, or emotions of another at a distance, without communication through the ordinary channels of sensation.
Note: The existence of this ability has not been proven scientifically.-- {Tel`e*path"ic}, a. -- {Te*lep"a*thist}, n. [1913 Webster +PJC]
telepathic adj : communicating without apparent physical signals
